news.title: Jangaon: 15 held in ₹4 crore Dharani-Bhu Bharati land registration scam
news.para: Jangaon police have arrested 15 individuals in a Rs 3.90 crore scam involving fraudulent land registrations on Dharani and Bhu Bharati portals. The gang allegedly manipulated challan amounts and submitted forged receipts, causing significant revenue loss to the state. Investigations are ongoing to apprehend the remaining nine accused.

news.title: M-sand producers warn of protest and seek action against illegal sand mining in Belagavi
news.para: M-Sand producers in Belagavi are threatening to protest against illegal sand and M-sand extraction and transportation. They allege that unlicensed units are causing significant revenue losses to the government and legitimate businesses. Despite submitting memorandums, authorities have reportedly taken no effective action, prompting the association to warn of intensified agitation.

news.title: Ahmedabad civic body launches asset monetisation drive to unlock revenue from its properties
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation's Asset Monetisation Cell is set to appoint a consultant to strategize the valuation and sale of its properties, including 4,113 leasehold assets estimated at over Rs 2,000 crore. The cell aims to boost non-conventional income by exploring options like developing reserved plots via PPP and renting school buildings.

news.title: NCLT approves Poonawalla Finance demerger splitting lending, real estate business
news.para: The National Company Law Tribunal has approved a major restructuring for Poonawalla Finance. This plan will split the company's lending and real estate businesses into separate entities. Poonawalla Finance will continue its lending operations. Its real estate assets will move to new companies, Rising Sun Holdings and Synergist Realtors. This move aims for sharper focus and better investor attraction.

news.title: Khata freeze leaves thousands of Bengaluru properties legally stranded
news.para: Years-long regulatory gaps at GBA have paralysed khata bifurcation and conversions, blocking sales, construction and loans, as officials promise internal fixes amid rising citizen frustration and financial stress

news.title: Gurugram: DTCP issues show-cause notice to Mayfield Garden RWA over alleged encroachment
news.para: Gurugram's DTCP has issued a show-cause notice to Mayfield Garden's RWA and a private entity for encroaching on 1.25 acres designated for a public dispensary in Sector 51. Unauthorized structures, including shops and hutments, were found on land reserved in the approved layout plan, violating urban development regulations.

news.title: Chandigarh: 4,500 properties mapped in sectors 2-17 under pilot survey
news.para: Chandigarh's NAKSHA pilot project is progressing well, with over 4,500 properties in Sectors 2-17 surveyed.  Despite tough weather, 20 teams are working towards a January 31, 2026 completion.  Deputy Commissioner Nishant Kumar Yadav praised the efforts, emphasizing accurate property records. Residents are urged to cooperate with survey teams for a smooth process.

news.title: Homestay benefits in Uttarakhand reserved for locals after misuse of scheme flagged
news.para: Uttarakhand's cabinet has decided to restrict homestay scheme benefits exclusively to state residents to promote local investment and revenue. This move aims to prevent non-residents from availing subsidies and ensure the scheme's original purpose of strengthening hill economies is met. The state will now focus on ensuring benefits reach deserving locals, fostering authentic cultural experiences for visitors.

news.title: Runwal Developers gets Sebi nod to float IPO
news.para: Runwal Developers plans to raise Rs 2,000 crore through its maiden public issue, comprising a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 1,700 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of Rs 300 crore by promoter Sandeep Subhash Runwal, as per the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP).

news.title: Sobha's net profit falls 28.87% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Sobha's net profit fell 28.87% in the December quarter.  However, sales value grew 52% year-on-year.  The company also saw a 35% increase in area sold.  For the nine months, net profit rose 89%.  Net debt turned negative.  Sobha completed 915 homes in the quarter.

news.title: Nagpur: Building material clogging Deo Nagar’s internal roads
news.para: Unregulated dumping of construction material is creating daily traffic bottlenecks and safety hazards in Deo Nagar's inner lanes. Heaps of sand, gravel, and debris are blocking roads, forcing vehicles to navigate cautiously and leading to frequent snarls. Residents are calling for proactive enforcement to address the worsening situation.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh may follow Mumbai model for development of Vizag 2.0 project
news.para: Andhra Pradesh officials studied Mumbai's development models to advance the Vizag Growth Hub initiative. They focused on CIDCO and MMRDA's self-sustaining financial strategies, particularly land monetization and FSI utilization, to guide the development of Bay City and Vizag 2.0 projects. These learnings aim to create a financially independent Visakhapatnam Economic Region.

news.title: Geberit posts 4.4% growth in sales in Q4 2025
news.para: Swiss plumbing powerhouse Geberit reported a 4.4% increase in sales during the fourth quarter. With expectations of a gradual rebound in Europe's construction realm by 2026, the firm is optimistic. Renovation projects are thriving, playing a crucial role in bolstering Geberit’s revenues.

news.title: Karan Johar buys apartment in Mumbai for ₹8.05 crore
news.para: Karan Johar has purchased an apartment in the Pali Vintage area of Khar West, Mumbai. This residence, spanning over 1,060.13 sq ft, comes with a price tag of ₹8.05 crore, complete with two dedicated parking spots.

news.title: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma buy 21,000 sq metre land parcels for ₹38 crore at Alibag
news.para: Cricketer Virat Kohli and actor Anushka Sharma have purchased land in Alibag. The property spans 1.36 hectares and was bought for Rs 37.86 crore. The deal was registered on January 13, 2026.

news.title: Average long-term mortgage rate in USA hits the lowest point in more than three years
news.para: American mortgage rates have fallen to their lowest in over three years. The 30-year fixed rate is now 6.06 percent.  Home sales have risen monthly but remain at a 30-year low. Refinancing applications have surged significantly.

news.title: Smartworks Coworking posts profit of ₹1.24 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Smartworks Coworking Spaces Ltd achieved a net profit of Rs 1.24 crore in the third quarter of this fiscal year. This marks a strong turnaround from a net loss in the same period last year. Total income saw a rise of 34 percent.

news.title: Bengaluru development body conducts door-to-door survey to identify tax dodging owners
news.para: The Greater Bengaluru Authority is conducting a large-scale survey to find property owners avoiding taxes. Surveyors are visiting every property, collecting data via a mobile app. This information will be cross-checked with satellite images and tax records. The drive aims to boost property tax collection, which has seen a significant dip this year.

news.title: Ludhiana civic body seals six commercial buildings
news.para: Municipal Corporation Ludhiana sealed six commercial buildings for illegal construction and unpaid dues. The action followed directions from MC Commissioner Aaditya Dachalwal. Meanwhile, Atam Nagar MLA Kulwant Sidhu intervened to stop the MC tehbazaari team from removing roadside vends on Model Town Road. Civic officials stated they would return to clear encroachments.

news.title: Land deals surge in Nagpur, revenue up ₹147 crore in nine months
news.para: Nagpur's property market surged over nine months, registering over 1.25 lakh land transactions and generating ₹1,568.60 crore in stamp duty revenue. This growth, fueled by infrastructure projects like New Nagpur and Metro expansion, saw urban transactions rise significantly while rural areas experienced higher property valuations despite a slight dip in transaction numbers.
